question_text: The volcanic islands in the above figure were created as the tectonic plate passed over a hot spot in the mantle. Based on the ages of the volcanic islands, in what direction was the tectonic plate moving toward?

Based on the hazard map of Mt. Rainier below, which of the following volcanic hazards has the furthest reaching effects (meaning, which hazard will affect people the greatest distance from the volcano)?

Continental rifts produce magma that is formed by [ Select ] ["volatile", "decompression", "heat transfer"] melting in the mantle with felsic magmas produced by [ Select ] ["partial melting of continental crust", "partial melting and fractionation of the mantle", "partial melting of the mantle"] .
dropdown_options: partial melting and fractionation of the mantle

answers.text: partial melting and fractionation of the mantle ->

question_text: Mauna Loa on Hawaii is an example of:

In the Mastering Geology assignment this week, we learned about Flood Basalts. One example was the Columbia River Flood Basalt Province. Which of the following are true about these flood basalts? (Select all that apply)

answers.text: These flood basalts are the result of a single, massive lava flow with the horizontal planes caused by tectonic stresses after solidification. ->
answers.match_pair: These flood basalts are the result of a single, massive lava flow with the horizontal planes caused by tectonic stresses after solidification. ->

answers.text: Thick layers of basalt indicate many repeated eruptions of multiple lava flows, with the youngest flows at the top. -> Your Answer: (You left this blank)
answers.match_pair: Thick layers of basalt indicate many repeated eruptions of multiple lava flows, with the youngest flows at the top. -> Your Answer: (You left this blank)

answers.text: The relatively flat features of solidified flood basalts is indicative of the very low viscosity of the lava when it was erupted and emplaced. -> Your Answer: (You left this blank)
answers.match_pair: The relatively flat features of solidified flood basalts is indicative of the very low viscosity of the lava when it was erupted and emplaced. -> Your Answer: (You left this blank)

answers.text: These flood basalts are the result of dramatically explosive eruptions that produced lots of pyroclastic material that is intermixed within the layers. ->
answers.match_pair: These flood basalts are the result of dramatically explosive eruptions that produced lots of pyroclastic material that is intermixed within the layers. ->

answers.text: The flood basalts have fine grained texture that indicates relatively fast, extrusive cooling. -> Your Answer: (You left this blank)
answers.match_pair: The flood basalts have fine grained texture that indicates relatively fast, extrusive cooling. -> Your Answer: (You left this blank)

answers.text: Yes, their high viscosity and high volatile content means they will always explode. ->
answers.match_pair: Yes, their high viscosity and high volatile content means they will always explode. ->

answers.text: Yes, even when an eruption starts off effusive, it will always eventually explode due to a build up of pressure. ->
answers.match_pair: Yes, even when an eruption starts off effusive, it will always eventually explode due to a build up of pressure. ->

answers.text: No, sometimes they produce lava domes that erupt very slowly over many years. ->
answers.match_pair: No, sometimes they produce lava domes that erupt very slowly over many years. ->
